docs.summary: Use Events API to manage events, collect RSVPs and sell tickets

permissions.name: Manage Events
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events.

docs.summary: Adds an input control to the draft form.

examples.title: Add phone
Add full address
Add single line address
Add date
Add +1 additional guest with mandatory guest name
Add multiple additional guests
Add dropdown
Add checkbox
Add comment text area
body:
curl -X POST 'https://www.wixapis.com/events/v1/events/ad18d12e-a6a9-4c17-abfa-6ff119479be2/form/control' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-H 'Authorization: <AUTH TOKEN>' \
-d @- << EOF
{
  "text": {
    "label": "Comment",
    "mandatory": true,
    "maxLength": 1000,
    "multiLine": true,
    "comment": true
  }
}
EOF

params.doc:
Policy agreement token. Required when the event has one or more policies. 
 Token must match with the token from [GetTokens](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/policy/get-tokens) response.

params.doc: Benefit granted by the pricing plan.

params.doc: Member ID (if empty - no site member is associated to this order).

params.name: discount
params.doc: Discount to apply on the invoice.

docs.summary:
Checkout reserved tickets.
 Creates order and associates it with a site contact.
 Guest details must be sent according to Registration Form input fields.
 (To change an existing "INITIATED, "PENDING", or "OFFLINE_PENDING" order, call the [Update Checkout](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/checkout/update-checkout) endpoint).

examples.title: Checkout

extra.description: A simple checkout when the guest is the buyer.

examples.title: Checkout with guest assigned tickets

extra.description: If guest assigned tickets is turned on of event, the guest form mus be filled for each of the ticket. Also buyer details has to be provided that will be visible in the order.

permissions.name: Manage Orders
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change orders.

docs.summary:
Changes order status to "CONFIRMED" - from "INITIATED, "PENDING", "OFFLINE_PENDING" to "PAID".  
 Previously confirmed orders (with status "PAID" or "FREE") are not changed.
 Confirming previously "INITIATED" or "PENDING" orders triggers an email with the tickets to the buyer (and to additional guests, if relevant and provided).

permissions.name: Manage Events
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events.

docs.summary:
Copies an event, including its registration form, notifications and tickets configuration - scheduled two weeks from the original event.
 Multilingual translations are also copied to the new event.

 When an event with same title already exists, appends (1), (2), ... to it. For example, copying an event titled "My Event" creates "My Event (1)".
 Very long event titles are cropped: "Daily stand-up ev... (2)".

Creates a policy for an event.
 Each event can have up to 3 policies.

permissions.name: Manage Events
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events.

params.name: language
params.doc:
Content language code in ISO 639-1 format.
 Used for translating ticket PDF labels, registration form, automatic emails, etc.
 Supported languages: ar, bg, cs, da, de, el, en, es, fi, fr, he, hi, hu, id, it, ja, ko, ms, nl, no, pl, pt, ro, ru, sv, th, tl, tr, uk, zh.
 Defaults to en.

docs.summary:
Creates a new event, with a default registration form in the given language.
 Default registration form includes first name, last name, and email inputs.
 To learn more about registration form and customize it, see [Registration Form](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/registration-form/about-the-registration-form-api).
 The event is automatically configured to send daily summary reports of new registrations to site business email.

examples.title: Create event
Create TBD event

params.name: policyAgreementToken
params.doc:
Policy agreement token.  Required when the event has one or more policies. 
 Token must match with the token from [GetTokens](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/policy/get-tokens) response.

 WIX_EVENTS.MANAGE_RSVP permission is required.

docs.summary:
Reserves tickets for 20 minutes.
 Reserved tickets are deducted from tickets stock and cannot be bought by another party.
 When the reservation expires, the tickets are added back in the stock.

members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type integer

members.name: score

Entity score.
 Higher is more relevant to search phrase.

docs.summary:
A coarse-grained representation of time duration divided into whole constituting components of days, hours, and minutes.
 For example, 25.5 hours duration is represented as `{ days: 1, hours: 1, minutes: 30 }`.

The form defines which elements are rendered in the Wix UI during the registration process (RSVP or checkout).
 It also contains customizable messages and labels.


 A form is an ordered list of controls (blocks), which accept guest information into a field input.

 Each control contains one or more nested inputs. For example, `Name` control has two inputs:
 - First Name
 - Last Name

 By default, name and email controls are always required and are pinned to the top of the form.

members.name: controls
members.doc: Nested fields as an ordered list.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Additional labels for multi-valued fields such as address.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

docs.summary: An input of one or multiple text values

members.name: options
members.doc: Predefined choice options for fields, such as dropdown.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Type which determines field format.
 Used to validate submitted response.

members.name: maxSize
members.doc:
A maximum accepted values for array input.
 Only applicable for inputs of valueType: TEXT_ARRAY.

members.name: additionalLabels
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Additional labels for multi-valued fields such as address.

members.name: maxLength
members.doc: Maximum number of accepted characters (relevant for text fields).

docs.summary:
A block of nested fields.
 Used to aggregate similar inputs like First Name and Last Name.

members.name: system
members.doc: Whether control is mandatory (such as name & email). When true, only label can be changed.

members.name: orderIndex
members.doc: Field controls are sorted by this value in ascending order.

docs.summary:
Defines form messages shown in UI before, during, and after registration flow.
 It enables configuration of form titles, response labels, "thank you" messages, and call-to-action texts.

members.name: registrationClosed
members.doc: Messages shown when event registration is closed.

docs.summary: Confirmation messages shown after registration.
Set of messages shown during registration when RSVP response is positive.

members.name: title
members.doc: Main form title for positive response.

docs.summary: Confirmation messages shown after registration.
A set of messages shown during registration with negative response

members.name: title
members.doc: Main form title for negative response.

members.name: waitlistMessages
members.doc: Messages shown for RSVP = `WAITING` (when event is full and waitlist is available).

members.name: message
members.doc: Message shown when event registration is closed.

members.name: scheduleTbd
members.doc:
Defines event as TBD (To Be Determined) schedule.
 When event time is not yet defined, TBD message is displayed instead of event start and end times.
 `startDate`, `endDate` and `timeZoneId` are not required when schedule is TBD.

members.name: timeZoneId
members.doc: Event time zone ID in TZ database format, e.g., `EST`, `America/Los_Angeles`.

members.name: endDateHidden
members.doc: Whether end date is hidden in the formatted schedule.

members.name: showTimeZone
members.doc: Whether time zone is displayed in formatted schedule.

members.name: startDateFormatted
members.doc: Formatted start date of the event (empty for TBD schedules).

members.name: startTimeFormatted
members.doc: Formatted start time of the event (empty for TBD schedules).

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Total guest limit available to register to the event.
 Additional guests per RSVP are counted towards total guests.

members.name: waitlist
members.doc: Whether a waitlist is opened when total guest limit is reached, allowing guests to create RSVP with WAITING RSVP status.

members.name: highestTicketPriceFormatted
members.doc: Formatted price of highest priced ticket.

members.name: lowestTicketPriceFormatted
members.doc: Formatted price of lowest priced ticket.

members.name: guestAssignedTickets
members.doc: Whether the form must be filled out separately for each ticket.

members.name: restrictedTo
members.doc: Types of users allowed to register.

members.name: restrictedTo
members.doc: Types of users allowed to register.

members.name: externalRegistrationUrl
members.doc: External event registration URL (for external events only).

members.name: currencyLocked
members.doc: Whether currency is locked and cannot be changed (generally occurs after the first order in the specified currency has been created).

members.name: revenue
members.doc:
Total revenue, excluding fees.
 (taxes and payment provider fees are not deducted.)

members.name: ticketingSummary
members.doc:
Summary of revenue and tickets sold.
 (Archived orders are not included).

members.name: publicGuestList
members.doc: Whether members can see other members attending the event (defaults to true).

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether online conferencing is enabled (not supported for TBD schedules).
 When enabled, links to join conferencing are generated and provided to guests.

members.name: hostLink
members.doc: Link for event host to start the online conference session.

members.name: guestLink
members.doc: Link for guests to join the online conference session.

members.name: password
members.doc: The password required to join online conferencing session (when relevant).

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: Instance ID of the site where event is hosted.

members.name: dashboard
members.doc: Event dashboard summary of RSVP / ticket sales.

members.name: slug
members.doc: Event slug URL (generated from event title).

members.name: language
members.doc: ISO 639-1 language code of the event (used in content translations).

members.name: feed
members.doc: Event discussion feed. For internal use.

members.name: about
members.doc: Rich-text content displayed in Wix UI - "About Event" section (HTML).

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event created timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event deleted timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event canceled timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event update timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event start timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: timestamp

members.name: startsIn

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event end timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: userId
members.doc: User who is related to event

members.name: global
members.doc: Whether filter is applied across all Wix sites

members.name: fieldset
members.doc:
Controls which event properties are returned. See [Fieldset](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/wix-events/fieldset#wix-events_wix-events_fieldset_event-fieldset).
 Some fields require additional computation that affects latency of the service.
 Use minimum set of required fieldset for best performance.

members.name: offset

members.name: facet

members.doc: Total cart amount before discount, tax, and fees.

members.name: grandTotal
members.doc:
Total amount of cart after discount, tax, and fees.
 Grand total is calculated in the following order:
   1. Total prices of all items in the cart are calculated.
   2. Discount is subtracted from the cart (if applicable).
   3. Tax is added (if applicable).
   4. Wix service fee is added.

 Format: `https://www.wixevents.com/check-in/{ticket number},{event id}`
 Example: `https://www.wixevents.com/check-in/AAAA-AAAA-BB021,00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000`

Possible values are:
  • INCLUDED - Tax is included in the ticket price
  • ADDED - Tax is added to the order at the checkout
  • ADDED_AT_CHECKOUT - Tax is added to the final total at the checkout

Possible values are:
  • FEE_ADDED - Fee is added to the ticket price at checkout
  • FEE_INCLUDED - Seller absorbs the fee. It is deducted from the ticket price
  • FEE_ADDED_AT_CHECKOUT - Fee is added to the ticket price at checkout

Possible values are:
  • INPUT - Single text value field.
  • TEXTAREA - Single text value field.
  • DROPDOWN - Single-choice field of predefined values.
  • RADIO - Single-choice field of predefined values.
  • CHECKBOX - Multiple-choice field of predefined values.
  • NAME - First and last name fields.
  • GUEST_CONTROL - Additional guests and respective guest names fields.
  • ADDRESS_SHORT - Single-line address field.
  • ADDRESS_FULL - Full address field.
  • DATE - Year, month and day fields.

Possible values are:
  • TEXT
  • NUMBER
  • TEXT_ARRAY
  • DATE_TIME
  • ADDRESS

Possible values are:
  • SCHEDULED - Event is public and scheduled to start

  • ENDED - Event has ended
  • CANCELED - Event was canceled

Possible values are:

Possible values are:

Possible values are:

Possible values are:

Possible values are:

Possible values are:
  • FULL

  • TEXTS - Include `about` event rich text in the response.

Possible values are:

Possible values are:
  • INSTANT_UPDATE - A quick update email when someone registers to the event (RSVP or ticket purchase).
  • DAILY_SUMMARY - Daily summary of all guests registered throughout the day. The email is sent around 10pm respectively to event's time zone. It contains a summary of all new guests registered in prior 24 hours.

Possible values are:
  • EVENTS_SUMMARY - Include summary of events

Possible values are:
  • SITE_SETTINGS - Add site settings in the response

Possible values are:
  • FUTURE_AND_PAST
  • FUTURE_ONLY
  • PAST_ONLY
